string.text: Ты схлусіў. Угода скасавана. Гуннар, рабі зь ім, што хочаш.
Пагражаеш? Ты не атрымаеш ані капейкі ад маіх дзядзяў, калі нашкодзіш мне.

Зараз Гунар кажа, што яны нават горшыя за каралёў і ярлаў, зь якімі мы змагаліся, бо рабуюць узьбярэжных земляробаў і рыбакоў. 'Няма гонару ў нападе на слабых', - ён столькі разоў казаў мне. І ён, вядома, меў рацыю - проста ў іх значна лягчэй адабраць багацьце!
Трэнероўка Трапнасьці
Адвязі мяне ў Осьцікан зараз

Наш захоплены карабель, Залатая Аса, хуткі ды манеўраны і на ім усталявана баліста. Калі мы максімальна аблегчым яго, прыбраўшы ўвесь груз, і пасадзім на вёслы нашых найдужых весьляроў, то зможам пазьбегнуць запаленай смалы і падплысьці на адлегласьць стрэлу. Потым мы зможам выкарыстаць балісту, каб па чарзе зьнішчыць манганэлі, а калі ўсе яны будуць зруйнаваны, нашы паплечнікі уварвуцца на борт і зачысьцяць палубы.
{.Muzcynski}Тхор
{.Muzcynski}Левіяфан
Які наш гранд план?
Выйсьці з Сюжэтнага Рэжыму
{.Zanocy}Нерэіда

Калі ты сапраўды хочаш паплысьці з намі, я з задавальненьнем вазьму цябе. Але я маю толькі адно месца. Таму, калі маеш кампаньёнаў, табе давядзецца пакінуць іх у гэтым порце. Без сумневу, ты хутка вернешся, каб уз'яднацца зь імі, {?PLAYER.GENDER}жывой і здаровай{?}жывым і здаровым{\?}.
{.Muzcynski}Джын-Гаспадар
Нам трэба абдумаць гэта, але, мажліва, пакінуць Крусаса з намі будзе нават карысна, бо ён можа пагутарыць з Пурыгам і яго камандай.
{SISTER.NAME}… Гэта ты? Гэта я!
{.Zanocy}Ламія
Перамажыце Падмацаваньні
Цяпер ты ў бясьпецы. Адпачні. Пагутарым потым.

Такім чынам… Хачу прадставіць цябе свайго старога знаёмага, Салаўтаса Крусаса, які здаўся, калі апошні яго чалавек загінуў ад нашых мячоў. Ён падаецца вельмі ўпэўненым у сабе для чалавека ў яго становішчы і, без сумневу, будзе спрабаваць выкруціцца з непрыемнай сітуацыі пагрозамі.

{PLAYER.NAME}… Дык… Я спраўдзіў словы Фахды пра Вландыйскіх піратаў, што працуюць на Пурыга, і плануюць скрасьці Стургійскае срэбра. Некалькі буйных патрульных вайсковых караблёў былі заўважаны каля {SETTLEMENT_LINK}. Падазраю, гэта Вландыйцы.
Флот Гандляра
{?PLAYER.GENDER}Гатова{?}Гатовы{\?} адплысьці ў Ангранфьёрд, каб ажыцьцявіць наш план? Пурыг, хутчэй за ўсё, ня будзе там доўга чакаць.
{.Muzcynski}Годны Ротбард
Сачы за гарызонтам і выгледжвай ветразі.
Выкінутыя караблі даюць уплыў.
Забейце ахоўнікаў як мага незаўважней.
Посьпех! Вы перамаглі флот Фахды.
Я {?PLAYER.GENDER}гатова{?}гатовы{\?} да дуэлі.
Я пакуль не {?PLAYER.GENDER}гатова{?}гатовы{\?} да плаваньня.
Выдатна! Дай ёй яшчэ адну, на посьпех.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Зеоніскі{#}Зеоніская{#}Зеоніскае{#}Зеоніскія{\#} {NAME}
{VALUE}% заробак вершнікаў падчас плаваньня.
Я Салаўтас Крусас. Я плаваю пад аховай Марскіх Ганчакоў. Калі заб'еш мяне, табе не паздаровіцца.

На мой пагляд, сапраўдны ваяр ведае сваю сілу. Яму ня трэба, каб іншыя напаміналі яму пра яго гонар. Ён ведае, што часам на вайне бываюць няўдачы — твой карабель спазьніўся, цябе зьнесла ў сьпешцы ўцёкаў, цябе перамог гаспадар, чые сілы нашмат перасягалі твае.
{.Mnozny}Лісты Расправы
{.Nijaki}Бедства Мораў
Мы вядзём вайну супраць Марскіх Ганчакоў, пірацкай канфедэрацыі.
{.Muzcynski}Бык
{#GENDER(NAME)}Осьціканскі{#}Осьціканская{#}Осьціканскае{#}Осьціканскія{\#} {NAME}
Флагманскі карабель дае бонус усім хаўрусным караблям.
{.Nijaki}Эль-Бонда
{.Muzcynski}Белы Драмадэр
Крусас! Крок наперад.
вандроўных скальдаў

Я падазраю, што Пурыг паспрабуе сплысьці як мага далей адсюль. Магчыма, на поўдзень ці ўсход… Магчыма, я буду шукаць яго гадамі, а можа, старасьць дагоніць мяне ў дарозе ці на моры. Я ня ведаю, ці сустрэнемся мы зноў.
{.Muzcynski}Дэльфін
{VALUE}% да плавальнай цягавітасьці каманды.
{.Zanocy}Марская Арда
{.Muzcynski}Нясучы Гора
Бывайце і посьпеху.
Брусы ў тваёй клетцы выглядаюць тоўстымі. Я цяпер ня маю часу, каб выбіць іх.
{.Nijaki}Марское Бамбаваньне
Вландыйскія Піраты
{.Zanocy}Сёмга

Цудоўна. Спадзяюся, ты некалі знойдзеш сваіх родных. Слухай, што б ні здарылася ў Хвальвіке, я вярнуся сюды і паспрабую знайсьці іншых ваяроў, якія дапамогуць мне. Калі некалі раздумаеш, шукай мяне тут, у Осьцікане.
{NAME} Паўднёвых Выспаў
То бок, гэта інфармацыя карысная для вас, так? Калі дадаць да яе выкуп, пра які я казаў, гэтага хопіць, каб выкупіць маё жыцьцё і волю?
Вызваліце палонных карабля, каб было мажліва адплысці на ім у бясьпечнае месца.
{.Zanocy}Рука Карабела
Захапіце Гандляра Крусаса
Кошт куплі і паляпшэньня караблёў гаспадарскага клану зьніжаны на 10%{newline}Вытворчасьць драўляных і кавальскіх майстэрняў зьніжана на 5% па ўсім гаспадарстве
Гэта апошні зь іх!
{VALUE} ліміт караблёў, якімі льга кіраваць.
Сабраць Падмацаваньні
{.Muzcynski}Нагльфар-Будаўнічы

Добра, некаторыя браты паслухалі яго, тыя, хто ваяваў супраць Вольбьёрна і каму багатая здабыча, прыпраўленая помстай, здавалася вельмі прывабнай. Але астатнія… Мы чулі падобныя абяцаньні і раней і не жадалі служыць ніводнаму гаспадару. Лепей ваяваць за золата… а калі хочаш, каб золата цякло ракой, ты мусіш выконваць свае дамовы, нават калі шыкоўны Кальрадыйскі гандляр прапануе табе багацьці сямі мораў.
Вы знаходзіцеся ў порце
{.Nijaki}Непераможнае Сонца

Уздоўж зьвілістых рэчышчаў вялікай ракі, што расьсякае стэп, ваша сям'я жыла ў вады. Карыстаючыся маленькімі самаробныя плытамі і чоўнамі, яны навучыліся ўважліва назіраць за багацьцямі ракі, зьбіраючы пэўныя раьсліны зь яе берагоў і ловячы рыбу на плыткаводзьдзі. Ад сваіх сьціплых бацькоў вы ўспадкавалі багаты запас ведаў.
Піраты - гэта адкіды. Давайце проста паплывём і разграмім іх.
{.Muzcynski}Конь Кітовага Шляху
З такім велізарным падвешаным багацьцем, Стургійцы маюць рацыю, што асьцярожнічаюць.
заахвочваць шляхту рабаваць варожую зямлю.
{.Muzcynski}Заяц
{.Zanocy}Чапля
You spent your adolescence helping your uncle with his fishing business, learning the ropes (literally!) of seamanship, from mending nets to hauling in the catch.
Фахда's flagship is going down. Defeat the rest of her fleet.
You declined to join {GANGRADIR.LINK} on his voyage, but may be able to find him later at {SETTLEMENT}.

Here's the detail that would interest you…. In addition to all the other delights that Крусас dangled before us, he also offered to build us ships. Пурыг was going to construct them in some northern anchorage called Ангранфьёрд, where he had brought a large number of captives to work in a shipyard.
Unchain yourself from the oar bench.
You make quick work of the alley thugs, and help their victim to his feet. He seems dazed, but grateful.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Соймавы{#}Соймавая{#}Соймавае{#}Соймавыя{\#} {NAME}
Leaving Story Mode
{.Muzcynski}Рачны Налётнік
{.Muzcynski}Ветранароджаны
Row! Let’s not be sitting ducks here.
Эдыкт Марскога Дабрабыту
{.Nijaki}Вясло
Bjolgur of Gauksdal! Well met! Are the Skolderbroda working for the merchants of {SETTLEMENT_LINK} now?
{.Zanocy}Сава
{.Nijaki}Страус
{.Muzcynski}Поўны Сіл
{.Muzcynski}Брамнік Раны
Prisoner ship
A fight, you say… I take it that Гуннар and you won?
Utgard's Joke
I am still not ready.
Undermanned ({AVAILABLE_CREW}/{NEEDED_CREW})
Reach the ship
Listen, you lot, I'm in a bit of a hurry. If I give you a penny each will you stop pestering me?
Hey! Over here! Let's not get separated.

You have arrived in {SETTLEMENT_LINK}. As you sail up the estuary into the harbor, you spot several large ships at anchor in a cove. They look like Vlandian craft, probably the pirates that Фахда told you about. They do not try to give chase, however, possibly because they saw you too late to raise sail, or perhaps because they are lying in wait for more lucrative prey.
We’re right behind you! Row, lads, row!
Well, {PLAYER.NAME}… Your sister is free, thank the gods. Пурыг may have gotten away, but I doubt the Sea Hounds will be troubling us much more.
{.Zanocy}Нявеста
{#GENDER(NAME)}Белы{#}Белая{#}Белае{#}Белыя{\#} {NAME}
allowing the ruler to collect a share of the revenue from the sales of ships.
You forced {HERO.NAME} to help you capture Пурыг's prisoner ship, promising him nothing. (+{CALCULATING_BONUS_AMOUNT} calculating bonus)
{VALUE} extra ammunition per stack for thrown weapons of the crew.
{.Muzcynski}Канкорд
Reach the open seas by avoiding enemy ships.
Several score, all in good health. We've been feeding them well, sparing no expense. We take pride in our work.
маракоў на куррахах
{.Muzcynski}Морж
Set all prisoners on the ship free.
Wait, I changed my mind.
{.Muzcynski}Самум
{VALUE} loyalty for each fishing boat returning to port.
Крывавае Абуджэньне
{.Muzcynski}Штармавы Дух
{.Muzcynski}Заклік Малака
{VALUE} building material in settlement for each merchant convoy visiting port

Just before I set sail for {SETTLEMENT_LINK}, my brothers and I had a visitor, a merchant named Салаўтас Крусас who said he was acting as an “ambassador” for Пурыг. He wanted us to break our contract with Balgard and ally with the Sea Hounds instead. He offered a great deal of money, too, and more - we could share in Пурыг's grand plan of conquest.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Марскі{#}Марская{#}Марское{#}Марскія{\#} {NAME}
Our fortunes have changed. This morning you were a captive, but now you are a lady of rank.
{.Zanocy}Кавалькада Джына
Successfully raiding a village grants the raiding clan +5 influence.{newline}For each lord party currently staying in a town owned by the kingdom, town security is reduced by 1 daily
Come down to the ship with me, then! Wind and tide are with us, and I won't tarry long.
{.Mnozny}Зубы Ветру

The alley thugs are too many for you, and knock you to the ground. Before they can finish you off, however, you hear a rush of feet and cries of alarm. The town watch must have heard the commotion, and your assailants make a quick retreat. The watch helps you to your feet and tells you to be more careful. The thugs' victim, dazed but apparently unhurt, introduces himself.

Acting on what you learned from Фахда, you and Гуннар sailed to the Sturgian port of Omor. There, you met another of Гуннар's old comrades, Bjolgur, a member of the Skolderbroda mercenary brotherhood. Bjolgur hoped to run the silver-ship past the Sea Hounds and enlisted you in his dangerous but effective plan to crash a fireship into their blockading fleet. In exchange, Bjolgur gave you information about a key Sea Hound ally, the imperial merchant Крусас, who he suspected would know more about your sister.
Ship Pulling machine
{.Muzcynski}Лобстар
The ruler is given a share of the revenue whenever one of the great houses of the realm sells a ship.
{.Muzcynski}Зэдросіс
You no longer have a seaworthy ship. Your party will land on the nearest shore.
{.Muzcynski}Баявы Кліч
{.Muzcynski}Пажыральны Воўк
Sail to the Skatria Islands off {SETTLEMENT_NAME}
Shipboard ballistas fire during sieges
I am Крусас Салаўтас. I seek Пурыг of Agilting.
маракоў
Heaven bless you, {?PLAYER.GENDER}Sister{?}Brother{\?}! I am ready to do my part, for our family and our future! But I can see your men calling you. Get us to safety, and we will speak again.
No, not yet.
Сьцяг Кальрадыёса
Kingdom-wide militia generation boost: +25%{newline}Kingdom-wide village production penalty: -5%
Разуменьне Карабела
The way is now clear to attack {HERO.NAME}'s fleet. Destroy it!
{.Zanocy}Німфа
{.Nijaki}Блакітнае Полымя
{VALUE}% to sail forces in missions.
{.Zanocy}Ухмылка Ахілеса
Ahoy! It's good to have you with us. We've seen sails, and I reckon that there are still pirates about.
{.Muzcynski}Змей

Your men make quick work of the pirates. As the fighting dies down, you find that the Sea Hounds were carrying captives, bound and stashed beneath the rowing benches. You cut their bonds and help them to their feet as your lookouts scan the waters for any sign of the second ship.

Growing up on the harsh Nordic coast, you were trained from a young age to spot enemy sails and signal incoming raids. Agile and quick-witted, you honed your skills with a throwing axe and learned to fight in skirmishes. You dream of joining a raiding party and tasting the glory of conquest.
{VALUE}% fire damage dealt by your ship and crew to enemy sails.
Hey you! Stranger! Would you like to help an old man drive off a few stray dogs here?
Once we get within range, their ballista will pelt us with fiery missiles. Avoid them – even if they just hit the water, the flames will keep burning and can spread to our hull.
You silenced those mangonels! Now let’s all move in and board them!
Success! You have run the Sea Hound blockade and reached the sea.
{.Muzcynski}Мядзьведзь Велоса

You are in the Skatrias. The jagged silhouettes of small rocky islands, streaked with gull dung, stretch southwest to the horizon.{NEW_LINE}{NEW_LINE}Through the hazy air you make out the outline of a sail. It’s still quite distant, but closing fast. They are clearly Sea Hounds, ready to pounce on anyone who ventures into their hunting grounds in the Skatrias.
You back out of the alley. You could easily escape, but you sense that the thugs will kill the old man.
Let me inspect your ships.
{.Muzcynski}Лотас
I accept your decision. Very well then…
{.Zanocy}Срэбная Русалка
You have arrived at Ангранфьёрд, Пурыг's lair.
Yes, take me to Осьцікан
{.Muzcynski}Селядзец

You met a Nord warrior named Гуннар, helping him defeat an ambush in a back alley of Осьцікан. You decided to join forces with him to battle the Sea Hounds, a pirate confederacy, and hunt for your sister. But no sooner did you set out with him then the two of you were betrayed by his old comrade Пурыг, who had joined the Sea Hounds. His men were lax, however, and you were able to break out of captivity and make off with one of his ships.
Find {HERO.NAME} in her hunting grounds in the Gulf of Charas
{VALUE}% melee weapon handling.
Are you ready to deal with those two Sea Hound vessels?
Defeat the Enemy Crew
I don't care about your old wars. You put my sister in a cage.
But that is all for nothing. Instead, the kings of Nordvyg, the men that {QUEST_5_COMPANION.NAME} and I fought, will have the last laugh. So, do you like what you've wrought?
{NAME} Парфумных Выспаў
{.Muzcynski}Зефір

{PLAYER.NAME}, welcome! I've been entertaining the village with tales of our adventurers. If you're looking for recruits, then I doubt you'll find a more promising batch than the lads of Lagsholfn. You always have a place by my hearth, old friend.

You return to Осьцікан harbor, and tie your ship up at the pier. Besides the Vlandian traders and fishing vessels lies a small Nordic longship. Гуннар tells you that some of his comrades have responded to his call to hunt the Sea Hounds. He tells you he needs to dictate a letter to some others, and asks you to meet him later in the port.
Come now, I couldn't have you dash off to hunt Крусас before the silver got past the Sea Hounds. My brothers named me their emissary, you see, and we diplomats need to be crafty.
{#GENDER(NAME)}Мусонны{#}Мусонная{#}Мусоннае{#}Мусонныя{\#} {NAME}
Naval Auto Battle Combat Penalty Negation Effect
You have successfully escorted the Vlandian merchants to {SETTLEMENT_LINK}.
{.Muzcynski}Віцязь

Listen, though… We need someone to steer the fireship. I'd do it myself, but my order wants me to stay close to the silver. I'd found a few volunteers who've offered to do it, but they keep sobering up.
{.Nijaki}Сонца Аліксеніёса
{.Zanocy}Рыба-Піла
Defeated corsair parties
{.Muzcynski}Мядзьведзь

You arrived at Ангранфьёрд and put your plan into action. While Крусас bantered with Пурыг's men, you and Гуннар swum to his prisoner ship and overcame the guards, sailing your sister to safety. Together with Lahar and Bjolgur you then engaged the Sea Hound fleet in a battle in the fjord. In the end, you fought Пурыг himself on his flagship and defeated him in a duel. You ended the Sea Hounds' reign of terror, and set your sister free. Гуннар awaits you in Осьцікан to say his farewells.
далучыліся да налётнікаў у ролі дазорцы.
пайшлі служыць на грабежным караблі.
{VALUE}% damage dealt by crew to enemy sails.

I've come to this port seeking warriors and a ship. These men we fought were allies of a pirate gang who call themselves the Sea Hounds. They have been raiding and slaving along the Nordvyg’s shores, and I intend to go to war with them.
I still have things to do on shore.
{NAME} Паўночных Зорак

So! {PLAYER.NAME}… You did well with that fireship! The silver is on its way to my order, and that bastard Пурыг will no doubt be much discomfitted. You helped me out there, so let me see if I can now help you.

Good, very good. With luck, the current shall carry it right into them, and they shall all merrily blaze up like a bonfire at a midwinter feast. The silver ship will make for the open sea, while the rest of us can have it out with any surviving Sea Hounds.
{.Zanocy}Вялікасьць
{VALUE}% melee damage dealt by crew when fighting on own ship.
{VALUE} morale for mariner troops at start of battle.
Can I tell Lahar that we are ready to sail? The tide and winds are with us, and it would be a pity if someone else were to hunt down Фахда and claim the bounty.
Strike hard, boys! Finish them!
{.Zanocy}Русалка
You'll get your share of Крусас' ill-gained wealth, never fear.
Ship Sails
{.Muzcynski}Зімародак
{.Zanocy}Вялікая Цеція
{.Muzcynski}Валадар Рагоў
{.Muzcynski}Крахаль
I will join you, and we can hunt together.
Skatria Islands
{VALUE}% to weight of mounts when in ship's cargo.
{.Muzcynski}Суверэнітэт
{.Zanocy}Устойлівасьць
{.Muzcynski}Мірмідон
Hailing point
Your allies were defeated. You will have to try again.
You'll just have to try and see.
Сойм і Народ
Speak to Гуннар and Your Sister
{VALUE}% extra ammo for crew.
Your family builded longships for the Sturgian river lords. You grew up amidst the sounds of hammering and the smell of tar, learning the craft of shipbuilding from your father and uncles.
Ach. We couldn't catch Фахда in time.
{.Zanocy}Сірэна
I need a bit more time.
Did you see that big fiery ball? Not very accurate, I’ll warrant, but if one of our ships gets hit by one of those… Those who don’t jump into the sea in time will die a nasty death.
Ahoy to you, Гуннар! An exemplary escape! Is the captive safe?
All clans within the kingdom benefit from a -15% reduction in ship purchase costs on own kingdom's ports.{newline}-10% tariff income
Рыбакі {VILLAGE_NAME}

The clang of hammer on hot iron was the defining sound of your upbringing. Your family were more than mere smiths; they were artisans who coaxed wonders from limited resources, shaping valuable iron into formidable weapons and treasured tools. From the forge, you learned to work with what little you had, understanding the unique properties of each piece and the almost magical skill required to transform it.

Вольбьёрн had made his point with a dozen headless bodies at his feet, and men paying the land-tax or serving in his armies were of more value to him than corpses. If I swore, a hundred of my comrades could return to their families. So I swore.

Your family's voices carried the tales of the North. Not grand courtly Skalds, but traveling storytellers with weathered cloaks and worn lutes. They wandered from village to village, weaving tales of heroes and hearth into songs and sagas. You grew up surrounded by the rhythmic strum of their instruments and the flickering firelight reflecting off their eyes as they spun fantastical yarns. These weren't just stories - they were the beating heart of Nord culture, passed down from generation to generation by your family's calloused hands and booming voices.

He chose, instead, to join the Skolderbroda, the Shield Brothers. Rather than fight for a king, he said, he would fight for whoever pays him. A king may turn out to be unworthy of his warriors' valor, but gold is never unworthy.

You arrived at Ангранфьёрд and put your plan into action. While Крусас bantered with Пурыг's men, you and Гуннар swum to his prisoner ship and overcame the guards, sailing your sister to safety. Together with Lahar and Bjolgur you then engaged the Sea Hound fleet in a battle in the fjord. In the end, you fought Пурыг himself on his flagship but spared his life after he bested you in one-to-one combat. You ended the Sea Hounds' reign of terror, and set your sister free. Гуннар awaits you in Осьцікан to say his farewells.

It’s hard to believe now, but they were once my brothers-in-arms. . Years ago we fought side-by-side in the last great rebellion in the north. Most of the clans and many freemen like myself refused to bow to Вольбьёрн the usurper, as he was then called. But Вольбьёрн knew how to speak to men’s desires. He won over the bigger clans with promises of land and silver, and when summer came and he brought a fleet to give us battle, he had with him so many long ships that their sails covered the horizon. We still fought them of course, but their numbers were too many to beat.

The lady is good at her craft. Фахда has been sailing since she was a child. She always wears a sailor’s cap, and underneath she is as bald as an egg. She persuaded her late father to take her to sea, so the story goes, by cutting off all of her long shining hair lest it catch in the rigging. She has taken several Quyazi ships, and I would be reluctant to fight her alone.

Often, when you were growing up, you wondered if your destiny might lie upon the sea. You listened closely to old sailors telling their tales of daring and peril: steering longships through the icy storms of the north, outfoxing corsairs along the pirate-infested coasts of the south, or standing in the forecastle of a dromon as it crashed through the enemy battle-line. You wonder what opportunities lie for you to seize on the seas of Calradia: a fortune made in the commerce and intrigues of a bustling port, or glory won on the bloodied deck of a foe's flagship.
issuing an edict granting special privileges to enterprises in coastal towns.

You grew up in a coastal village, surrounded by tales of legendary Viking warriors and their daring voyages. As a youth, you learned the skills of a sailor, a warrior, and a raider, preparing for the day when you would join your kin on a voyage of exploration and conquest.

When last we met, I was intending to sail with my old friend Пурыг. Well, I always fancied myself a good judge of character, but I suppose fond memories of my warlike youth went to my head like ale. Пурыг betrayed me. Like so many of my comrades from those days, he turned Sea Hound. I escaped his clutches however, and returned here. I know a great deal more about their operations.
That's fine, but I was expecting more.

One of your sharper-eyed sailors thinks he sees a ship. You stare at the horizon, and though at first it's hard to make out shapes against the choppy waves of the gulf, you eventually distinguish the unmistakable outline of a lateen sail. It's a corsair, and it's heading directly towards you.

My men, though… Well, some of them have been quite impressed by your leadership. They want to follow you, if you'll have them. And as I mentioned, they prefer to sail on our ship here, the Wave-Steed, so I guess that's yours too, if you'll have it. She'll carry you well, especially in the rough seas of the north.
They must think we're just a fishing vessel. All right now, boys, let's show them that their prey has teeth of its own!

We fought, but we lost, in a great battle in Хвальвік Bay. I and a hundred other captives were led before Вольбьёрн, and the king ordered his men to take our heads. As they held me down to receive the blow, I told Вольбьёрн that it was a good thing I'd eaten not long ago, so I could let him know directly from the High Hall what sort of feast they'd prepared for him there.

That captive we took, Hralgar, said that the Sea Hounds expect to find rich pickings near Beinland. I think I know what he is talking about. Every year, a Vlandian merchant ship travels to the far north, bearing hunters and other fortune-seekers. It should be returning south around this time. These men have spent the last months gathering walrus ivory, fur and whale oil, all of which are quite valuable in the southlands.

Anyway, I had originally wanted to join up with a merchant returning to Vlandia from Хвальвік, and I think that plan is still a good one. His company has spent the last months hunting and whaling in the far north, and their ship is laden with valuables. I am certain that the Sea Hounds will be unable to resist such a tempting target.
How do we counter this?
